Title.language: The Martyrdom of the Distinguished Coptic Engineer Sa-eed Ebn Kateb El-Faraghany
The Martyrdom of the Distinguished Coptic Engineer Sa-eed Ebn Kateb El-Faraghany

text.language: On this day also the distinguished Coptic engineer Sa-eed Ebn Kateb El-Faraghany was martyred.
On this day also the distinguished Coptic engineer Sa-eed Ebn Kateb El-Faraghany was martyred.

He was commissioned to build the Nilometre in el-Rhoda (Gaziret el-Roda) in the year 864 A.D. during the reign of the Abbassid Caliph El-Motawakel. When Ahmad Ibn-Tulun reined Egypt, he entrusted him to build the most significant of his installations. He built for him the arched bridges, viaducts of Ibn-Tulun and the well by the pool of El-Habash to supply water to the city of al-Qatta’i, the capital of his kingdom, between the years 872 – 873 A.D.

He built for him the arched bridges, viaducts of Ibn-Tulun and the well by the pool of El-Habash to supply water to the city of al-Qatta’i, the capital of his kingdom, between the years 872 – 873 A.D.

Later on Ibn-Tulun considered building a mosque to be the most splendid mosque in Egypt. The mosque was to be built on 300 marble pillars and he was told to gather these pillars from some of the churches after demolishing them. When the illustrious Coptic engineer Sa-eed, heard this news, he was grieved and was concerned about demolishing all these churches. He wrote a letter to Ibn Tulun to inform him that he can build this mosque without pillars except two for the Qibla. He drew a sketch of the mosque on a parchment and sent it to him with his letter. Ibn-Tulun marveled and approved it. He commissioned him to build the mosque which was built as exquisite as it could be.

The Mosque of Ibn-Tulun is still present in the district of Tulun in Cairo. This building is a testimony to the brilliance of this illustrious Coptic engineer who incorporated arcades and arches in the mosque before the art of arcades was known in Europe and the other countries of the world.

Title.language: The Eighth Day of the Blessed Month of Koiahk
The Eighth Day of the Blessed Month of Koiahk
اليوم الثامن من شهر كيهك المبارك

text.language: Today is the eighth day of the blessed month of Koiahk. May God begin it in goodness and renew it for us in peace and tranquility, while our sins and iniquities are forgiven through the tender mercies of our Lord, O my fathers and my brethren. Amen.

اليوم الثامن من شهر كيهك المبارك، أحسن الله إستقباله، وأعاده علينا وعليكم ونحن وأنتم في هدوء واطمئنان، مغفوري الخطايا والاثام والزلات، من قبل مراحم الرب يا ابائي وإخوتي. آمين.

Title.language: The Martyrdom of St. Esi (Isi) and His Sister Thecla
The Martyrdom of St. Esi (Isi) and His Sister Thecla
إستشهاد القديس إيسى وتكلا أخته

text.language: On this day of the year 20 of the martyrs (304 A.D.) St. Esi and his sister Thecla were martyred. These two saints were born in the latter part of the third century to pious Christian parents from the city of Abu-Sair. They were wealthy and charitable to the poor and the needy.

On this day of the year 20 of the martyrs (304 A.D.) St. Esi and his sister Thecla were martyred. These two saints were born in the latter part of the third century to pious Christian parents from the city of Abu-Sair. They were wealthy and charitable to the poor and the needy.

فى مثل هذا اليوم من سنة 20 للشهداء (304 م) استشهد القديس ايسى وتكلا أخته. ولد هذان القديسان فى أواخر القرن الثالث الميلادى من أبوين مسيحيين تقيين فى بلدة " أبى صير " (بلدة أثرية مازالت باقية باسمها و هي تابعة لمركز الواسطى محافظة بنى سويف بها كنيسة أثرية قديمة). وكانا غنيين يكثران العطاء والصدقةعلى الفقراء و المساكين.

St. Esi travelled to Alexandria to visit one of his friends, which coincided with the time when St. Victor, the son of Romanus (Ebn-Romanus), came to Alexandria. When Esi knew of his good strife and of his renouncing of the world, he became envious of his biography and his endurance for the sufferings. Especially when he knew that St. Victor was the son of a councilor in the Roman Court, a high ranking officer in the Roman army and a close acquaintance of the Emperor. Esi wished to follow his example, so he went to Armanius the governor and confessed his faith in the Lord Christ before him.

سافر القديس إيسى إلى الإسكندرية لزيارة أحد أصدقائة واتفق موعد سفرة مع مجئ القديس بقطر بن رومانوس إليها. فغار القديس إيسى من سيرته و احتماله العذابات ، خصوصا ً أنة كان ابنا ً للوزير و قائدا ًكبيرا ً فى الجيش و من المقربين للملك. فتقدم إيسى إلى الوالى أرمانيوس و أعترف أمامه بالسيد المسيح.

The Angel of the Lord appeared to his sister Thecla in her hometown and ordered her to go to meet her brother in Alexandria. She embarked on a ship and while on board the Virgin St. Mary and St. Elizabeth appeared to her and comforted and encouraged her. St. Elizabeth told her, "I have a son, they beheaded him unjustly," and the Virgin St. Mary told her, "I have a Son whom they crucified with envy." Thecla did not recognize them.

The Angel of the Lord appeared to his sister Thecla in her hometown and ordered her to go to meet her brother in Alexandria. She embarked on a ship and while on board the Virgin St. Mary and St. Elizabeth appeared to her and comforted and encouraged her. St. Elizabeth told her, "I have a son, they beheaded him unjustly," and the Virgin St. Mary told her, "I have a Son whom they crucified with envy." Thecla did not recognize them.

وظهر ملاك الرب لأخته تكلا فى بلدها و أمرها بالذهاب إلى الإسكندرية لمقابلة أخيها فركبت مركبا ً وسافرت إلى هناك وفى السفينة ظهرت لها القديسة مريم العذراء والقديسة أليصابات يعزيانها و يشجعانها، وكانت العذراء تقول " إن لى إبنا ً صلبوه حسداً". وكانت أليصابات تقول " إن لى ابنا ً قطعوا رأسة ظلماً " ، ولم تكن تكلا تعرفهما.

When she arrived to Alexandria and met her brother, they agreed together to confess the Lord Christ. The governor tortured them severely, at times by the Hinbazeen (the squeezing wheel), and at other times by scorching them. When the governor became weary of torturing them, he handed them over to his son, the governor of the city of El-Khosos, to take them to Upper Egypt. When they had sailed for a short while, the boat stopped. The governor ordered them beheaded and cast their bodies into the weeds and the wild plants. Thus, they received the crown of martyrdom.

و لما وصلت إلى الإسكندرية إنضمت إلى أخيها فى الاعتراف بالمسيح فعذبهما الوالى كثيرا ً تارة بالحرق ثم سلمهما الوالى إلى ابنه الذى كان واليا ً على منطقة الخصوص ليذهب بهما إلى الصعيد. و لما سارت المركب قليلا ً توقفت عن المسير ، فأمر الوالى المرافق لهما بقطع رأسيهما وبطرح جسديهما بين الشوك والحلفاء. وهكذا نالا إكليل الشهادة.
The Lord inspired a priest called Macarius from Shatanuf to take their holy bodies. He buried them with great veneration.

وأوحى الرب إلى قس بناحية شطانوف يدعى مكاريوس فأخذ جسديهما و دفنهما بإكرام جزيل.

Title.language: The Martyrdom of the Two Saints: Barbara and Juliana
The Martyrdom of the Two Saints: Barbara and Juliana
إستشهاد القديستين بربارة و يوليانة

text.language: On this day also of the year 237 A.D., Sts. Barbara and Juliana were martyred. Barbara was the daughter of a wealthy noble pagan man from the city of Nicomedia called Dioscorus. Because of his great love for his daughter, he built her a tower to live in and erected around it idols so she would continue in worshipping the gods that he worshipped. St. Barbara rose up her eyes to heaven from the top of the tower contemplating the beauty of the sky and what was in it: the sun, the moon and the stars. She came to the conclusion that the universe must have an able and wise maker who is worthy of worship and honor.

On this day also of the year 237 A.D., Sts. Barbara and Juliana were martyred. Barbara was the daughter of a wealthy noble pagan man from the city of Nicomedia called Dioscorus. Because of his great love for his daughter, he built her a tower to live in and erected around it idols so she would continue in worshipping the gods that he worshipped. St. Barbara rose up her eyes to heaven from the top of the tower contemplating the beauty of the sky and what was in it: the sun, the moon and the stars. She came to the conclusion that the universe must have an able and wise maker who is worthy of worship and honor.

و فيه أيضا ًمن سنة 237 م إستشهدت القديستان بربارة و يوليانة. كانت بربارة ابنة رجل عظيم فى مدينة نيقوميدية يدعى ديسقوروس. ولشدة محبته لها أقام لها برجا ً لتقيم فيه وأقام حوله الأصنام لتظل متعبدة للآلهة الوثنية التي يعبدها. و حدث أن رفعت القديسة بربارة بصرها إلى السماء من أعلى البرج وتأملت ما فيها من نجوم وكواكب و إستنتجت أنه لابد أن يكون للكون صانع مبدع حكيم تجب له العبادة والإكرام.

Origen, the scholar, happened to be in this area and was informed of the saint and her longing for knowledge by one of her Christian maidservants. He came to her and taught her the principles of the Christian religion. Barbara was enlightened with divine light. She was baptized in the name of the Father and the Son and the Holy Spirit and received the Holy Mysteries by the hands of a Christian priest.

وإتفق وجود العلامة أوريجانوس فى تلك البلاد فعلم بخبر هذه القديسة و تعطشها للمعرفة وذلك عن طريق إحدى جواريها المسيحيات. فأتى إليها وعلمها مبادئ الدين المسيحى فامتلأت بربارة بالنور الإلهى و إعتمدت باسم الثالوث القدوس و تناولت من الأسرار المقدسة على يد كاهن مسيحى.

There were two windows in the bathroom of her palace and she ordered a third one to be opened and a large cross to be placed over the water basin. When her father came to see her and saw the changes that were done, he asked her for the reason. She told him, "Did you not know, my father, that with the Trinity everything is complete, and these three windows are after the name of the Holy Trinity: the Father, the Son, and the Holy Spirit. This sign (the Cross) is the sign of the Lord Jesus Christ, through whom was completed the salvation of the whole world. I ask you, O my dear father, to turn away from the delusion that you are living in and worship the God who created and redeemed you." When her father heard these words, he became very angry, and drew his sword to slay her. She fled away and he ran after her. There was a rock in front of her that split into two halves and she went through it. The rock then returned to its earlier state. However, her father’s heart was more hardened than the rock. He went around the rock searching for her, and found her hiding in a cave. He jumped over her as a wolf, seized her and dragged her to the governor Marcianus. At first the governor talked to her in a friendly way, making many promises, and then he threatened her, but could not take away her love for the Lord Christ. Therefore, he ordered to torment her with different kinds of tortures.

وكان فى حمام قصرها طاقتان فأمرت بفتح طاقة ثالثة كما وضعت صليبا ً كبيراً على حوض الماء. فلما دخل أبوها ورأى التغيير الذى طرأفسالها عن السبب فقالت : " أما تعلم يا أبى أن كل شئ بالثالوث يكمل فهذه الثلاث طاقات على إسم الثالوث القدوس الآب والإبن والروح القدس. وهذه العلامة هى علامة السيد المسيح الذى به كان خلاص العالم فأسألك يا أبى العزيز أن تتراجع عن الضلال الذى تعيش فيه وتعبد الإله الذى خلقك و فداك". ولما سمع أبوها هذا الكلام غضب جداً وجرد سيفه ليقتلها فهربت من أمامه فجرى خلفها و كانت أمامها صخرة فإنشقت الى نصفين ، و عبرت القديسة من خلالها ثم عادت الصخرة إلى حالتها الأولى وبذلك هربت منه. ولكن قلب أبيها كان أقسى من الصخر فدار حول الصخرة يبحث عنها فوجدها مختبئة فوثب عليها كالذئب وجرها إلى الوالى مركيانوس الذى لاطفها أولاً بالكلام اللين والوعود الكثيرة ثم أخذ يهددها و يتوعدها و لكنه لم يستطع أن يسلبها حبها للسيد المسيح عند ذلك أمر بتعذيبها بكل أنواع العذاب.

There was a young girl named Juliana who was watching St. Barbara being atrociously tortured and she wept for her. Juliana saw the Lord Christ strengthening and comforting St. Barbara. She was also enlightened and believed in the Lord Christ. The governor ordered her be tortured also along with St. Barbara. All the means of torture failed to change their faith in the Lord Christ. Therefore, he ordered to behead both of them by the sword.

Therefore, he ordered to behead both of them by the sword.

وكانت هناك صبية صغيرة اسمها يوليانة تشاهد القديسة بربارة وهى فى هذه العذابات المريعة فكانت تبكى لأجلها. ثم رأت السيد المسيح يعزى القديسة بربارة و يقويها فاستنارت بصيرتها أيضاً و آمنت بالسيد المسيح فأمر الوالى أن تعذب هى أيضا ً مع القديسة بربارة. ولكن لم تفلح وسائل التعذيب فى تحويلهما عن إيمانهما بالسيد المسيح فأمر بقطع رأسيهما بحد السيف.

When Barbara heard the order of the governor, she prayed to God to accept her soul and that of Juliana. They came forward unafraid of death and the swordsman beheaded them and they both received the crowns of martyrdom.

When Barbara heard the order of the governor, she prayed to God to accept her soul and that of Juliana. They came forward unafraid of death and the swordsman beheaded them and they both received the crowns of martyrdom.
ولما سمعت القديسة بربارة بأمر الوالى صلت إلى الله أن يقبل روحها وروح يوليانة أيضاً. ثم تقدمتا غير خائفتين من الموت فنزع السياف رأسيهما و نالتا أكاليل الشهادة معاً.

St. Barbara's father perished shortly afterwards by a horrible death and so did the governor who tortured them. As for the water basin that had the cross over it in the tower, its water had the power of healing for everyone who washed himself with it.

St. Barbara's father perished shortly afterwards by a horrible death and so did the governor who tortured them. As for the water basin that had the cross over it in the tower, its water had the power of healing for everyone who washed himself with it.
و بعد ذلك مات والد بربارة أشَر ميتة كذلك كانت نهاية الوالى الذى أمر بتعذيبهما. أما حوض الماء الذى كان عليه الصليب فى قصر بربارة فقد صارت للمياة فيه قوة الشفاء لكل من يغتسل منه.

They placed the bodies of these two saints in a church in the region of Galatia. After a period of years, they relocated their bodies to Egypt to the church that is named after St. Barbara in Old Cairo.

وجعلوا جسدى هاتين القديستين فى كنيسة خارج مدينة غلاطية و بعد مدة من الزمان نقلوا جسديهما إلى مصر و وضعوهما فى الكنيسة التى تحمل إسم القديسة بربارة بمصر القديمة.
The blessing of their prayers be with us all. Amen.

Title.language: The Departure of the Saint Abba Samuel the Confessor
The Departure of the Saint Abba Samuel the Confessor
نياحة القديس الأنبا صموئيل المعترف

text.language: Also on this day of the year 412 of the martyrs (696 A.D.), the great saint Abba Samuel the confessor, the head of El-Qalamoun Monastery, departed. This saint was born in one of the villages of the diocese of Masil. Arselaos, his father, who was a priest, saw in a night vision, a luminous man telling him, "Your son must be entrusted with a large congregation, for he is chosen by the Lord."

Also on this day of the year 412 of the martyrs (696 A.D.), the great saint Abba Samuel the confessor, the head of El-Qalamoun Monastery, departed. This saint was born in one of the villages of the diocese of Masil. Arselaos, his father, who was a priest, saw in a night vision, a luminous man telling him, "Your son must be entrusted with a large congregation, for he is chosen by the Lord."

وفيه أيضا ً من سنة 412 للشهداء (696 م) تنيح القديس العظيم الأنبا صموئيل المعترف رئيس دير القلمون. وُلد هذا القديس فى إحدى قرى كرسى ميصيل (هى حاليا ً مليج مركز شبين الكوم محافظة المنوفية). كان أبوه سيلاس كاهناً. فأبصر فى رؤيا الليل شخصا ً مضيئا ً يقول لة " لابد لإبنك أن يؤتمن على جماعة كبيرة ويكون مختارا ً أمام الرب".

Samuel was pure from his youth like Samuel the prophet. When he grew up, he became a monk in the wilderness of Scetis at the hands of a holy man called Abba Agathon. Abba Samuel lived with Abba Agathon for three years in total obedience. After the departure of Abba Agathon, the monk Samuel dedicated himself to fasting and prayers. Therefore, he was ordained a priest for the church of St. Macarius the Great.

Samuel was pure from his youth like Samuel the prophet. When he grew up, he became a monk in the wilderness of Scetis at the hands of a holy man called Abba Agathon. Abba Samuel lived with Abba Agathon for three years in total obedience. After the departure of Abba Agathon, the monk Samuel dedicated himself to fasting and prayers. Therefore, he was ordained a priest for the church of St. Macarius the Great.

الصبى طاهرا ً مثل صموئيل النبى و لما كبر ترهب فى برية شيهيت عند القديس أغاثون فأقام معه ثلاث سنين طائعاً. وبعد نياحة الأنبا أغاثون تفرغ الراهب صموئيل للصلوات والأصوام فرسموه قسا ً على كنيسة القديس مكاريوس الكبير.

One day, an envoy came to the desert carrying Leo's Tome and when the envoy read it to the elders and the monks, they asked them to endorse and sign it. Abba Samuel became zealous with divine zeal. He jumped up and seized the Tome and rent it in pieces and did not endorse it. When the imperial envoy saw this, he became furious and angry. He ordered him beaten with whips and tortured. One of these strikes hit his right eye causing him to loose it. They then expelled him from the monastery.

و حدث فى هذه الأيام أن أتى إلى البرية رسول من الوالى يحمل طومس لاون (هو رسالة بها قرارات مجمع خلقيدونية الذى يقول بالطبيعتين و المشيئتين فى السيد المسيح) فلما قرأه الرسول على الرهبان و طلب منهم التوقيع عليه غار الأنبا صموئيل غيرة الرب ومزق المكتوب ولم يوافق عليه فلما رأى رسول الوالى ذلك أمر بتعذيبه و ضربه بالسياط فصادفت إحدى اللطمات عينه اليمنى فقلعتها ثم طرده من الدير.

The Angel of the Lord appeared to St. Samuel and commanded him to depart and to dwell in El-Qalamoun Mount. He went there and built a monastery, lived in it for a while teaching and instructing those gathered around him and confirming them in the Orthodox faith.

فظهر له ملاك الرب و أمره أن يسكن بجبل القلمون فمضى إلى هناك و بنى ديرا ً وأقام فيه مدة يعلم و يتلمذ الآتين إليه من الرهبان و طالبي الرهبنة و يثبتهم على الإيمان الأرثوذكسي المستقيم.

Shortly after the Berbers attacked the monastery and took Abba Samuel with them on their way back to their country. There he found Abba Yoannis (John) the Hegumen of Scete and they comforted each other. The captor of Abba Samuel tried to persuade him to worship the sun, but he refused. When he failed, the devil enticed him to tie the leg of Abba Samuel to the leg of one of his maidens and send them to attend to the camels. He intended for Abba Samuel to fall into sin with her and then he would submit to him. With the grace of God he was saved from this cruel temptation.

و بعد قليل هجم البربر و أخذوه معهم إلى بلادهم و هناك وجد الأ نبا يوأنس قمص شيهيت فكان الاثنان يتعزيان معا ً. وحاول الرجل الذى سباه أن يغويه إلى عبادة الشمس فرفض و بالإيعاذ بحيلة من الشيطان ربط رجليه مع رجلى جارية من جواريه وكلفهما برعاية الإبل معاً قصدا ً منه أن يقع معها فى الخطية و عند ذلك يوجهه حسب هواه و قصده و بمعونة الله الحافظة نجا من هذه التجربة القاسية.

Later, the master's son fell ill and was close to death; Abba Samuel prayed for him and the boy was healed of his sickness. His master greatly loved him, apologized for all that he had done and asked for Abba Samuel's forgiveness. He offered to him to ask for anything he wished. Abba Samuel asked to return back to his monastery and he allowed him to go back.

When Abba Samuel returned, many of his sons the monks gathered around him and they increased until they numbered in the thousands. The Virgin St. Mary appeared to him and told him, "This place shall be my abode forever," and from that day the Berbers never attacked this monastery again.

و فى الدير اجتمع حوله أولاده الرهبان حتى بلغوا الألوف وظهرت له القديسة العذراء قائلة : " إن هذا الموضع يكون مسكنى إلى الأبد ".

Abba Samuel wrote prophesies, many discourses and spiritual articles. When the time of his departure drew near, he gathered together his sons and commanded them to be steadfast in the faith and the fear of God till their last breath, then departed in peace. His body is located in his monastery near Maghagha, El-Qalamoun Mount, in the Western desert.

وقد وضع هذا القديس نبوات و مواعظ و مقالات روحية كثيرة. ولما قربت أيام نياحته جمع أولاده و أوصاهم أن يثبتوا فى الإيمان و مخافة الله إلى النفس الأخير ثم تنيح بسلام. و اليوم يوجد جسده بديره العامر بالرهبان تجاه مغاغة بجبل القلمون بالصحراء الغربية.
The blessing of his prayers be with us all. Amen.

Title.language: The Departure of St. Heraclas (Yaraklas), 13th Pope of Alexandria
The Departure of St. Heraclas (Yaraklas), 13th Pope of Alexandria
نياحة البابا ياروكلاس البطريرك الثالث عشر من بطاركة الكرازة المرقسية

text.language: On this day also of the year 240 A.D., the Holy Father, Pope Heraclas (Yaraklas), the 13th Pope of Alexandria, departed. This Holy Father was born to pagan parents who believed in the Lord Christ and were baptized after his birth. They taught him Greek philosophy, then the Christian doctrines. He excelled in preaching and teaching. St. Demetrius, the 12th Pope of Alexandria, loved him and ordained him a deacon, then a priest for the church of Alexandria. He was liked by everyone and many came to listen to his sermons and teachings.

He was liked by everyone and many came to listen to his sermons and teachings.

و فيه أيضا ً من سنة 240 م تنيح البابا القديس ياروكلاس البطريرك الثالث عشر من بطاركة الكرسى المرقسى. ولد هذا القديس من أبوين وثنيين إلا أنهما آمنا بالسيد المسيح وإعتمدا بعد ولادته فأدباه بالآداب المسيحية فبرع فى الوعظ والتعليم فأحبه البابا ديمتريوس الأول ورسمه شماسا ً ثم قسا ً على مدينة الإسكندرية فأقبل الجميع لسماع وعظه وتعاليمه.

In the year 224 A.D., he was enthroned and shepherded the flock of Christ with the best of care. He brought many to the faith. Pope Heraclas sat on the throne of St. Mark for 16 years, one month and 26 days then departed in peace.

Title.language: The Ninth Day of the Blessed Month of Koiahk
The Ninth Day of the Blessed Month of Koiahk
اليوم التاسع من شهر كيهك المبارك

text.language: Today is the ninth day of the blessed month of Koiahk. May God begin it in goodness and renew it for us in peace and tranquility, while our sins and iniquities are forgiven through the tender mercies of our Lord, O my fathers and my brethren. Amen.

Today is the ninth day of the blessed month of Koiahk. May God begin it in goodness and renew it for us in peace and tranquility, while our sins and iniquities are forgiven through the tender mercies of our Lord, O my fathers and my brethren. Amen.
اليوم التاسع من شهر كيهك المبارك، أحسن الله إستقباله، وأعاده علينا وعليكم ونحن وأنتم في هدوء واطمئنان، مغفوري الخطايا والاثام والزلات، من قبل مراحم الرب يا ابائي وإخوتي. آمين.

Title.language: The Departure of St. Poemen the Confessor
The Departure of St. Poemen the Confessor
نياحة القديس بيمن المعترف

text.language: On this day St. Poemen, the confessor, the martyr without bloodshed, departed. He was born in one of the villages of the district of el-Ashmunain . When he grew he worked as steward for a rich noble man. Because of his honesty, chastity and uprightness, everybody loved him.

On this day St. Poemen, the confessor, the martyr without bloodshed, departed. He was born in one of the villages of the district of el-Ashmunain . When he grew he worked as steward for a rich noble man. Because of his honesty, chastity and uprightness, everybody loved him.
فى مثل هذا اليوم تنيح القديس بيمن المعترف الشهيد بدون سفك دم. ولد بإحدى بلاد الأشمونين و لما كبر عمل وكيلا ً لأعمال أحد الأراخنة ولطهارة يديه و تقواه أحبه الجميع.

Because of his disdain for the vanities of this world, he left his work and went to a monastery in this region wherein he became a monk. When the rich man, his former employer, knew about it, he went to him and asked him to come back to his job, but he refused. The saint went on with his fervent worship and austere asceticism. He longed to become a martyr, so he went to Ansena and found many Christians being tortured for the Name of Christ. He also went forward and confessed his faith in the Lord Christ. They tortured him severely by beating him, burning, and dismemberment and by squeezing him with the Hinbazeen. During all these tortures, the Lord Christ strengthened him and healed his wounds. While he was suffering in this manner, Constantine the Great became emperor and ordered all those who were in prison because of their faith in the Lord Christ to be set free. The Lord Christ appeared to Anba Poemen and commanded him to make known to all the saints in prison that the Lord had reckoned them among the martyrs and called them the confessors.

ولاحتقاره أباطيل العالم. ترك عمله وقصد ديرا ً فى تلك النواحى ليترهب هناك. ولما علم هذا الأرخن مضى إليه و سأله العودة إلى خدمتة فرفض و إستمر فى رهبنتة وعبادته. ثم رغب أن يكون شهيدا ً على إسم السيد المسيح فمضى إلى أنصنا و وجد كثيرين من المسيحيين يعذبون على إسم المسيح فتقدم هو أيضا ً و إعترف بالسيد المسيح فعذبوة عذابا ً بالضرب و الحرق و تقطيع الأعضاء و العصر بالهنبازين وكان السيد المسيح يشفيه من جراحاته و يقويه. و فيما هو على هذه الحال مَلك قسطنطين الكبير و أمر بإخراج كل الذين فى السجون بسبب الإيمان. فظهرالسيد المسيح لهذا القديس و أمره أن يخبر جميع المسجونين بأنه قد حسبهم فى جملة الشهداء و دعاهم معترفين.

When St. Poemen was released from prison, he dwelt in a monastery outside the city of El-Ashmunain. God had granted him the gift of healing the sick and his fame spread in the adjacent areas. The Empress of Rome became ill with a grievous sickness which was difficult to cure. She came to the city of Ansena, and the governor of the city and his men accompanied her to where St. Poemen was. When they informed him of the Empress' presence, he did not go out to meet her but said, "What have I to do with the kings of the earth." When the brethren besought him to go out to meet her, he hearkened to them. When she saw him, she bowed down at his feet. The saint prayed for her and she was immediately healed.

ولما خرج القديس بيمن من السجن سكن فى دير خارج الأشمونين و أنعم عليه السيد المسيح بموهبة الشفاء ، فشاع ذكره في النواحي المجاورة. وحدث أن مرضت ملكة روما بمرض عضال إستعصى شفاؤه فأتت إلى أنصنا و صحبها الوالى ورجاله إلى حيث يوجد القديس بيمن. و لما أعلموه بحضورها لم يبادر إلى لقائها بل قال : "ماذا لى مع ملوك العالم ". ولما ألح عليه الإخوة خرج إليها فلما رأته سجدت عند قدميه فصلى القديس من أجلها فبرئت فى الحال.

When Abba Poemen grew old, he became ill. He gathered the monks and told them that the time of his departure to be with the Lord had come. He instructed them with many useful commandments then delivered up his soul. They all were sorrowful for his departure and buried him with great veneration. Many healing signs were manifested through his body.

Title.language: The Departure of St. Nicholas, Bishop of Myra
The Departure of St. Nicholas, Bishop of Myra
نياحة القديس نيقولاوس أسقف مورا

text.language: On this day of the year 58 of the martyrs (342 A.D.) the righteous St. Nicholas , Bishop of Myra (Mora) departed. His father's name was Epiphanius and his mother’s name was Tounah. Besides being wealthy, they were God-fearing also. They had no children to bring joy to their hearts. When they grew old God had compassion on them and gave them this saint. The child was filled with divine grace since his childhood. When he grew, he demonstrated distinction in learning which indicated that the Holy Spirit was inspiring him. Since his young age he learned the Church subjects and was ordained a deacon.

On this day of the year 58 of the martyrs (342 A.D.) the righteous St. Nicholas , Bishop of Myra (Mora) departed. His father's name was Epiphanius and his mother’s name was Tounah. Besides being wealthy, they were God-fearing also. They had no children to bring joy to their hearts. When they grew old God had compassion on them and gave them this saint. The child was filled with divine grace since his childhood. When he grew, he demonstrated distinction in learning which indicated that the Holy Spirit was inspiring him. Since his young age he learned the Church subjects and was ordained a deacon.

فى مثل هذا اليوم من سنة 58 للشهداء (342 م) تنيح القديس البار نيقولاوس أسقف مورا. كان اسم أبيه أبيفانيوس و إسم أمه تونة وقد جمعا إلى الغنى الكثير مخافة الله ولم يكن لهما ولد. ولما تقدما فى الأيام تحنن الله عليهما ورزقهما هذا القديس الذى امتلأ من النعمة الإلهية منذ طفولته المبكرة. ولما كبر أظهر نبوغا ً واضحاً فى تلقى العلم مما دل على أن الروح القدس كان يلهمه. و منذ حداثته عرف علوم الكنيسة و رُسم شماسا.

He lived a life of asceticism and moral excellence. When they recognized his advancement in grace and piety they ordained him a priest. God granted him the gift of working signs, healing the sick and casting out the evil spirits.

He lived a life of asceticism and moral excellence. When they recognized his advancement in grace and piety they ordained him a priest. God granted him the gift of working signs, healing the sick and casting out the evil spirits.
فعاش عيشة النسك و الفضيلة ولما رأوا تقدمه فى النعمة رسموه قساً. و أعطاه الله موهبة عمل الآيات و شفاء الأمراض وإخراج الشياطين.

There was a very rich man in the city of Myra who lost all his wealth and became in need of his daily rations. He had three daughters who had passed the age of marriage, and could not get married because of their father’s poverty. Satan wickedly suggested to the man to make his daughters work in evil places. God revealed to St. Nicholas what this man intended to do. St. Nicholas took one hundred dinars of his father's money and tied it up in a sack, and during the night he threw it into the window of that man's house. When the man found the gold, he was astonished and rejoiced and was able to give his eldest daughter away in marriage. During another night the saint threw another hundred dinars into the man's house and the man was able to give his second daughter away in marriage. The man wanted to know who this charitable person was. The third time when the saint threw the gold into the house, the man was watching and immediately he went out of his house running to see who was throwing the gold to him. He found St. Nicholas and the man bowed down at his feet and paid him great homage and thanked him because he saved his daughters from poverty and from a life of sin.

وكان بمدينة مورا رجل غنى أحنى عليه الدهر و فقد ثروته حتى إحتاج إلى القوت الضرورى و له ثلاث بنات قد تجاوزن سن الزواج و لم يتزوجن بسبب فقر والدهن فوسوس له الشيطان أن يوجههن للعمل فى الأماكن الشريرة. فكشف الرب للقديس نيقولاوس ما إعتزمه الرجل. فأخذ كيسا ً به مائة دينار و ألقاة ليلاً من نافذة منزل الرجل ، فاندهش الرجل جداً وفرح و إستطاع بهذا المال أن يزوج ابنته الكبرى. وفى ليلة أخرى ألقى القديس كيسا ً آخراً من النافذة فتمكن الرجل من أن يزوج ابنته الثانية. واشتاق الرجل أن يعرف مَن هذا المحسن؟ فسهر ليلاً حتى وقت سقوط الكيس الثالث فأسرع لوقته ليرى من الذى ألقاه و عرف أنه القديس نيقولاوس. فخر عند قدميه و شكره جداً لأنه أنقذ بناته من فقر المال و من سوء السيرة والمصير.
When the Bishop of Myra departed, the people chose him to be their bishop. He took it upon himself to be the good shepherd who gives his life for the sheep.

Shortly after, Diocletian incited the persecution against the Christians. He imprisoned many of them and closed their churches. St. Nicholas encouraged them to endure the persecution and to steadfast in the faith. The soldiers seized him and tormented him with many tortures. He remained in prison until the reign of Emperor Constantine who released all those who were imprisoned for the sake of the faith. St. Nicholas was one of them and he returned to his parish with great honor.

وبعد مدة أثار دقليديانوس الإضطهاد على المسيحيين و قبض على الكثيرين منهم وأقفل كنائسهم وكان القديس نيقولاوس يشجعهم على إحتمال الاضطهاد و التمسك بالإيمان. فقبض عليه الجند ، و عذبوه عذابات كثيرة مريرة. و بقى فى السجن حتى ملك الإمبراطور قسطنطين و أخرج جميع المسجونين لأجل الإيمان وكان منهم هذا القديس فعاد إلى كرسيه مكرما ً.
He was one of the 318 bishops assembled in the city of Nicea in the year 325 A.D. to judge Arius the heretic.

Having finished his course and guarded his flock, he departed to be with the Lord. He sat on the Episcopal throne for more than forty years, and all the days of his life were about 80 years.

Title.language: The Martyrdom of St. Shura of Akhmeem
The Martyrdom of St. Shura of Akhmeem
استشهاد القديس شورة من أهل أخميم

text.language: On this day also of the year 20 of the martyrs (304 A.D.) St. Shura, a native of Akhmeem, was martyred. This saint was born in the city of Shansheef , the district of Akhmeem and he was a sheep keeper.

On this day also of the year 20 of the martyrs (304 A.D.) St. Shura, a native of Akhmeem, was martyred. This saint was born in the city of Shansheef , the district of Akhmeem and he was a sheep keeper.

وفيه أيضاً من سنة 20 للشهداء (304 م) إستشهد القديس شورة من أهل أخميم. ولد هذا القديس بناحية شنشيف (حاليا ً نسمى عرب بنى واصل مركز الساقلية و بها دير القديس الأنبا توماس السائح) التابع لأخميم وكان راعيا ً للغنم.

When Arianus, the governor of Ansena, went to Akhmim, they brought before him the young man Shura. He asked him about his name and his hometown. Shura answered; “I am Christian, I work as a sheep keeper and I am a native of Tanay but I live in Shansheef.” The Governor was amazed of his courage and his young handsome look nevertheless he ordered him to raise incense to the idols lest he would torture him. St. Shura bravely answered him; “I only worship my Lord Jesus Christ, and whatever you wished to do, do it speedily.”

ولما نزل أريانوس الوالى إلى أخميم أحضروا إليه الشاب شورة فسأله الوالي عن إسمه و بلده فأجابة أنا مسيحى وأعمل راعى أغنام من أهل طناى و ساكن بشنشيف. فتعجب الوالى من شجاعته و حسن شبابه وأمره أن يرفع البخور للآلهة لئلا يعذبه. فأجابه بشجاعة قائلاً " إنى لا أعبد غير ربى يسوع المسيح و مهما أردت إصنع بى عاجلا ً.

The Governor ordered to squeeze him with the Hinbazeen, then lit fire under him, direct torches to his sides, and to rub his body with vinegar mixed with salt. He thankfully endured all these tortures. When they cast him in prison, he stood up to pray. The angel of the Lord appeared to him and strengthened him saying; “Fear not for you shall receive the crown of glory tomorrow.”

The next morning the Governor brought a magician who prepared for the saint a chalice filled with poison. When St. Shura held the chalice it fell from his hand on the ground and broke. A serpent came out of the chalice and the saint stepped on it. The sorcerer marveled and told the Governor; “I have nothing to do with him for his God is Mighty.”

وفى الغد أحضر الوالى ساحرا ً مزج له كأس سم فلما أمسكه القديس إنفلت من يده و وقع على الأرض فخرجت منه أفعى داسها بقدميه. فتعجب الساحر وقال للوالى : " ليس لى به شأن لأن إلهه قوى ".

When the Governor failed to change his resolve he ordered to behead him and hang his body on the wall of his village for the birds of prey to devour his flesh. The soldiers did as they were ordered so he completed his good strife and received the crown of martyrdom.

Title.language: The Relocation of the Body of St. Severus, Patriarch of Antioch
The Relocation of the Body of St. Severus, Patriarch of Antioch
تذكار نقل جسد القديس ساويرس بطريرك أنطاكية

text.language: Also on this day of the year 255 of the martyrs (539 A.D.), the body of St. Severus, Patriarch of Antioch, was relocated to el-Zogag Monastery.

و فيه أيضا ً من سنة 255 للشهداء (539 م) تم نقل جسد القديس ساويرس بطريرك أنطاكية إلى دير الزجاج.

This Holy Father departed in the city of Sakha at the house of a righteous Archon called Dorotheus, where he was hiding. Dorotheus sent the body, in a ship, with some of his trustworthy men to el-Zogag Monastery, located west of Alexandria to be buried there.

وذلك أنه تنيح فى سخا (هى مدينة تابعة لمحافظة كفر الشيخ زارتها العائلة المقدسة و يوجد بها الحجر المطبوع عليه قدم السيد المسيح) عند أرخن مبارك اسمه دوروثيئوس فأرسله مع بعض رجاله فى سفينة إلى دير الزجاج غرب الإسكندرية ليدفن هناك.

When the boat sailed in the Nile, it came to a place where the water was so shallow for the boat to sail and the crew became perplexed and worried. Nevertheless, God brought about this miracle, for He made the boat to sail in shallow water for six miles until they arrived to the shore of the Mediterranean Sea. Then they sailed in the Sea westward until they reached el-Zogag Monastery on the seashore. They brought down the body with great veneration and laid it in the place which Dorotheus had built for it. God worked great signs and wonders through his pure body.

Title.language: The Departure of Anba Pijimi, the Anchorite
The Departure of Anba Pijimi, the Anchorite
نياحة القديس الأنبا بيجمى السائح

text.language: This day marks the departure of Anba Pijimi, the anchorite. He was a native of Feesha , diocese of Masil. When he was twelve years old, and while he was tending to his father's sheep, the angel of the Lord appeared to him in the form of a young man. The angel told him, "Let us go to the wilderness for you to become a monk." Abba Pijimi agreed and went with him to the desert of Scetis; to a place where three elder monks dwelt. The angel handed him to them then disappeared. St. Pijimi enjoyed the life in the wilderness. He lived among them for twenty-four years until they all departed.

فى مثل هذا اليوم تنيح الأنبا بيجمى السائح. كان من أهل فيشا التابعة لكرسى ميصيل (هى الآن قرية مليج مركز شبين الكوم منوفية) ولما بلغ الثانية عشر من عمره كان يرعى غنم أبيه فظهر له ملاك الرب فى هيئة شاب وقال له : "هلم نذهب إلى البرية لتصير أنت راهبا ً" فوافقه وأتى إلى برية شيهيت إلى موضع به ثلاثة شيوخ و هناك سلمه لهم الملاك ثم غاب عنهم. أستعذب القديس بيجمى الحياة فى البرية و أقام عند أولئك الشيوخ أربع وعشرين سنة حتى تنيحوا جميعا ً.

Subsequently, Anba Pijimi left that place and went into the inner desert, a distance of three days travel. The devils appeared to him in the form of wild beasts, pigs and serpents. They surrounded the saint to devour him, but he was able to recognize their vices by the spirit. He prayed to God who vanished all of them.

He lived in that place for three years. He fasted a week at a time; then he ate a handful of dates and drank a little water to the point that his skin cleaved to his bones. He reached a high level of spirituality.

ثم أقام فى هذا المكان ثلاث سنوات يصوم أسبوعا ً أسبوعا ً ثم يأكل ملء قبضة يده تمرا ً مع قليل من الماء حتى لصق جلده بعظامه و وصل إلى درجة السياحة الروحانية.

At the end of the three years, the angel of the Lord appeared to him and commanded him to return to his hometown. Abba Pijimi obeyed and returned back, and built outside it a small hut (cell). He dwelt there alone devoting himself to worshiping and asceticism. He became a good model and a good example for everyone came to see him. The people of his hometown came to him to be nourished with his profound spiritual teachings.

One day the great saint Abba Shenouda , the Archimandrite, saw a shining pillar and heard a voice saying, "This is Abba Pijimi the anchorite." Abba Shenouda went to him and they recognized each other by a divine guidance. Abba Shenouda visited with him for a few days then returned to his monastery.

When the days of his repose from this world drew near, he called his disciple and informed him of his departure and commanded him to bury his body in the place where he dwelt. Title.language: The Martyrdom of St. Abtelmaos (Ptolemy), a Native of Denderah
The Martyrdom of St. Abtelmaos (Ptolemy), a Native of Denderah
إستشهاد القديس أبطلماوس من أهل دندرة

text.language: On this day also St. Abtelmaos (Ptolemy) was martyred. He was a native of Denderah (Tentyris), west of Qena. He was an only child to his parents who raised him up in a true Christian upbringing and reared him up on the ecclesiastical ethics. When he became a young man, he met St. Paphnoute the anchorite in the mountains of this area. He advised him to go to Ansena to an ascetic father called Dorotheus and foretold him about the tribulations that he will face and encouraged him to endure them.

When he became a young man, he met St. Paphnoute the anchorite in the mountains of this area. وفيه أيضا ً استشهد القديس أبطلماوس من أهل دندرة بغرب قنا. كان وحيدا ً لوالديه وقد ربياه تربية مسيحية وهذباه بالآداب الكنسية. و لما أصبح شابا ً التقى بالقديس ببنودة السائح بجبال هذه المنطقة. فنصحه أن يذهب إلى أنصنا إلى عابد يدعى دوروثيئوس و أنبأه بالتجارب التى ستصادفة و شجعه لكى يحتملها.

When he came to Anba Dorotheus, he advised him to go to the city of Ansena (Antione), confess the Lord Christ, to receive the crown of martyrdom. St. Abtelmaos entered the city and confessed the Lord Christ before the Governor. He suffered many tortures which he endured patiently. Finally the Governor ordered to hang him up on a high mast then one of the soldiers stabbed him in his neck so he delivered up his soul and received the crown of life.

The faithful carried his pure body and buried him with great veneration. When the era of persecution ended, they built a church, relocated his pure body to it and many signs were manifested from his relics.

Title.language: The Commemoration of the consecration of the Church of St. Claudius (Ekladius), in the city of Bakour, district of Abu-Taig

text.language: Also on this day the church celebrates the commemoration of the consecration of the church of the martyr St. Claudius (Ekladius) the son of Ptolemy (Abtelmaos), who was Emperor Numerianus brother. This church is located in the city of Bakour, district of Abu-Taig, Assiut governorate. This church still exist till present time.

Title.language: The Commemoration of the Honorable Michael, the Archangel
The Commemoration of the Honorable Michael, the Archangel
تذكار رئيس الملائكة الطاهر ميخائيل

text.language: The church celebrates on this day the monthly commemoration of the honorable Archangel Michael, the head of the heavenly hosts. He is standing before the Pantocrator interceding on our behalf saying, "O You who are merciful, do not be angry. O Righteous One, have mercy on Your creation. O You Who is long suffering, do not perish the work of Your Hands."

O You Who is long suffering, do not perish the work of Your Hands."

May his holy intercession be with us all. Amen.

Title.language: The Departure of St. Hedra, Bishop of Aswan
The Departure of St. Hedra, Bishop of Aswan
نياحة القديس الأنبا هدرا الأسوانى

text.language: On this day also of the year 111 of the martyrs (395 A.D.), the great father Abba Hedra, Bishop of Aswan, departed. His parents, who were Christians, raised him well and taught him the fear of God since his young age. When he was eighteen years old, his parents wanted him to marry one of his relatives, but he refused with the excuse that he was ill. The next morning he went to church early, asking the Lord Christ to let him hear through the readings of the Holy Scriptures, what agrees with what was in his heart. He heard what comforted him.

His parents, who were Christians, raised him well and taught him the fear of God since his young age. When he was eighteen years old, his parents wanted him to marry one of his relatives, but he refused with the excuse that he was ill. The next morning he went to church early, asking the Lord Christ to let him hear through the readings of the Holy Scriptures, what agrees with what was in his heart. He heard what comforted him.

وفى مثل هذا اليوم من سنة 111 للشهداء (395 م) تنيح الأب العظيم الأنبا هدرا الأسوانى. ولد هذا القديس من أبوين مسيحيين تقيين ربياه و علماه مخافة الرب منذ صغره. ولما بلغ ثمانى عشرة سنة أحب والداه أن يزوجاه من إحدى قريباته و لكنه أمتنع بحجة المرض ولما كان صباح اليوم التالى ذهب إلى الكنيسة مبكرا ً وطلب من السيد المسيح أن يسمعه من أقوال الكتب المقدسة ما يتفق مع ما فى قلبه فسمع ما أستراح إليه.

When he left the church, he saw a deceased person being carried to the cemetery. He walked among the mourners, talking to himself saying, "Listen O Hedra, it is not this one that died but you yourself who should die to this futile world." After they had buried the deceased one he did not return to his home but went to be a monk in one of the monasteries.

ولما خرج من الكنيسة رأى ميتاً محمولا ً ذاهبين به إلى المدافن فسار مع المشيعين وكان يحدث نفسه قائلاً :" إسمع يا هدرا ليس هذا هو الذى مات و لكنك أنت يجب أن تموت عن العالم الزائل". ولما دفنوا الميت لم يعد إلى بيته بل ذهب ليترهب فى أحد الأديرة.

When his family and friends heard of what he had done, they went and told him, "In so doing you had brought grief to us and you can worship God in any place." When they failed to bring him back they returned with grief-filled hearts for being separated from him.

و حدث لما سمع أقاربه وأصدقاؤه فأتوا إليه وقالوا له : "إنك بعملك هذا تجلب علينا الحزن وتستطيع أن تعبد الله فى أى مكان". وإذ لم يفلحوا فى إرجاعه معهم عادوا والحزن يملأ قلوبهم على فراقه.

Henceforth St. Hedra went on fervent worship, asceticism, fasting, uninterrupted prayers, and numerous prostrations, under the guidance of his spiritual father St. Poemen. Eight years later, he lived a solitary life in a cave fighting the devil that tempted him frequently but the Lord saved him from it all.

Later on the bishop of the city of Aswan departed, some of its people went to the monastery where St. Hedra was ordained a monk. There they heard from the monks about the life of this father, his knowledge and his virtues. They unanimously agreed on choosing him. They went to his cave and he responded to their request for he had seen a vision in which the Lord Christ declared to him that he will be the bishop for the diocese of Aswan.

They went to his cave and he responded to their request for he had seen a vision in which the Lord Christ declared to him that he will be the bishop for the diocese of Aswan.

This father devoted himself to exhort his people, teach them, and guide them to the way of eternal life. God performed many miracles by his hands. When he completed his life in a good repute, departed in peace. A monastery carry his name still exist west of Aswan.

Nevertheless, God with His sublime wisdom did not permit their martyrdom and they were released from their imprisonment, and one of them was St. John the Egyptian.

Title.language: Assembly of a Council in Rome against Benates (Novatus) the Priest
Assembly of a Council in Rome against Benates (Novatus) the Priest
انعقاد مجمع برومية على نوباطس القس

text.language: On this day also, of the year 249 A.D., a Council assembled in the city of Rome attended by sixty bishops, eighteen priests and a deacon from the scholars of Rome. The council was presided by St. Cornelius, Bishop of Rome, to judge the priest Novatus (Benates). He claimed that; “whoever denied the faith in the time of persecution, his repentance will not be accepted.” He based his erroneous teaching on the words of our teacher St. Paul in his epistle to the Hebrews, "For it is impossible for those who were once enlightened, and have tasted the heavenly gift, and have become partakers of the Holy Spirit, and have tasted the good word of God and the powers of the age to come, if they fall away, to renew them again to repentance, since they crucify again for themselves the Son of God, and put Him to an open shame." (Hebrews 6:4-6)

وفيه أيضا ً من سنة (249 م) إنعقد مجمع بمدينة رومية حضره ستون أسقفا ً و ثمانية عشر قسا ً و شماسا ً من علماء رومية برئاسة القديس كرنيليوس أسقف رومية ، لمحاكمة القس نوباطس الذى ابتدع قائلا ً : " من ينكر الإيمان وقت الاضطهاد لا تقبل توبته" معتمدا ً على قول معلمنا بولس الرسول:" لأن الذى إستنيروا مرة ، وذاقوا الموهبة السماوية وصاروا شركاء الروح القدس وذاقوا كلمة الله الصالحة وقوات الدهر الآتى وسقطوا لايمكن تجديدهم أيضاً للتوبة إذ هم يصلبون لأنفسهم ابن الله ثانية ويشهرونه" (عبرانيين 6 : 4 – 6).

The fathers explained to him that the apostle St. Paul did not say this concerning those who repent but concerning those who intends to be baptized after each time they sin, for baptism can be carried on only once. Therefore, the apostle went on saying, "They crucify again for themselves the Son of God." The apostle here explains that since the crucifixion happened only once, so is baptism. As for the door of repentance, is open to every repentant, otherwise everyone who falls in the sin of denying Christ or commit a sin will not be accepted even if he repents. That would mean then that David's repentance was not accepted, and when the apostle St. Peter denied the Lord Jesus then repented and wept, his repentance also was not accepted.

Therefore, the coming of the Holy Spirit upon St. Peter would be worthless also, setting him to shepherd His flock, invalid, and that would nullify every baptism he performed. So generally speaking, according to Novatus' opinion, every sinner would have perished and that is extreme ignorance.

You exiled him after depriving him from the fellowship of the church.

Title.language: The Thirteenth Day of the Blessed Month of Koiahk
The Thirteenth Day of the Blessed Month of Koiahk
اليوم الثالث عشر من شهر كيهك المبارك

text.language: Today is the thirteenth day of the blessed month of Koiahk. May God begin it in goodness and renew it for us in peace and tranquility, while our sins and iniquities are forgiven through the tender mercies of our Lord, O my fathers and my brethren. Amen.

استشهاد القديس برشنوفيوس الراهب

text.language: This day also marks the martyrdom of St. Barsanuphius, the monk, in the early days of the Arab conquest of Egypt. He dwelt in the church of Mari Mina in old Cairo (Fum-El-Khaleeg). He worshipped God with dedication and intensity. He fasted praying incessantly with many prostrations.

This Holy Father was born in the city of Tima, Souhag governorate. His parents raised him with a Christian upbringing. When he grew he became a monk in the Monastery of Anba Antonios.

Title.language: The Departure of St. Aprakius
The Departure of St. Aprakius
نياحة الأب ابراكيوس

text.language: On this day also, St. Aprakius (Abracas) departed. He was from Upper Egypt and became a monk in one of the monasteries when he was twenty years old. He fought a perfect fight until Satan grew tired of tempting him. Satan appeared to him and said; "You still have fifty more years to live in this world so have mercy on yourself," wishing by these words to cast the saint into laziness and sloth. The wise old saint replied, "You have made me sorrowful for I have thought that I had another hundred years to live and I have slackened in my fight and in my worship. If this is the case, I have to strife harder before I die." In this way, he overcame the devil and his evil artifices. He departed in peace in the same year after spending seventy years of worship and asceticism.

Title.language: The Departure of St. Elias (Elijah) the Anchorite

text.language: Today also marks the departure of St. Elias (Elijah) the Anchorite in the Mount of Samhoud. This saint was born to Christian parents in the area of Fayyom. They made an annual banquet on the feast of the prophet Elisha. They often saw the prophet Elijah and Elisha his disciple.

The Lord sent His Archangel Michael who told them, “The Lord has accepted your supplications and alms and He will give you a son and you shall call him Elias (Elijah) for he will be great and dwell in the desert.” They rejoiced and thanked God for the glad tidings. They increased in their charitable deeds and giving alms.

He went to the monastery of Anba Pachomius in Upper Egypt where he put on the monastic Eskeem. Then he went up Mount Shamah where he dwelt for two years. After moving around to different places, he finally settled on Mount Samhoud. After a long struggle, he departed in peace.

The blessing of his prayers be with us all. Amen.

Title.language: The Consecration of the Church of St. Misael the Anchorite
The Consecration of the Church of St. Misael the Anchorite
تكريس كنيسة القديس ميصائيل السائح

text.language: On this day also we commemorate the consecration of the Church of St. Misael, the anchorite in the monastery of Anba Samuel the confessor in Qalamun Mount. This saint was born to rich Christian parents. When he was six years old, his parents departed. The bishop of his hometown took care of raising him. When he grew up, he longed for the monastic life, so he went to Abba Isaac the abbot of the monastery. He introduced himself and asked to accept him as a monk in the monastery. He happily accepted him and put on him the holy monastic Eskeem. From then on, he lived a solitary life in worship and asceticism.

و فيه أيضا ً تذكار تكريس كنيسة القديس ميصائيل السائح بدير القديس الأنبا صموئيل المعترف بجبل القلمون. ولد هذا القديس من أبوين مسيحيين غنيين ولما بلغ السادسة من عمره تنيح والداه ، فاهتم الأب الأسقف بتربيته ولما كبر إشتاق إلى الرهبنة ، فذهب إلى الأنبا إسحق رئيس الدير و عرفه بنفسه وطلب منه أن يقبله راهبا ً فى الدير. فقبله الأنبا إسحق فرحا ً وألبسهُ إسكيم الرهبنة المقدس. فانفرد فى عبادة ونسك و بعد قليل جاء الآباء السواح وأخذوه معهم للسياحة في البرية.

Shortly after, the fathers the anchorites came and took him to live with them in the wilderness. St. Misael later on came back with a group of the anchorites to Abba Isaac and told him, “Go to the bishop of my town, inform him of my circumstances, and take from him my father’s money with which you can build a church after my name.”

Abba Isaac did as St. Misael told him and built the church. While the father, the bishop, was consecrating the church on this day, St. Misael and the fathers, the hermits, came and attended the consecration prayer.

Title.language: The Fourteenth Day of the Blessed Month of Koiahk
The Fourteenth Day of the Blessed Month of Koiahk
اليوم الرابع عشر من شهر كيهك المبارك

text.language: Today is the fourteenth day of the blessed month of Koiahk. May God begin it in goodness and renew it for us in peace and tranquility, while our sins and iniquities are forgiven through the tender mercies of our Lord, O my fathers and my brethren. Amen.

اليوم الرابع عشر من شهر كيهك المبارك، أحسن الله إستقباله، وأعاده علينا وعليكم ونحن وأنتم في هدوء واطمئنان، مغفوري الخطايا والاثام والزلات، من قبل مراحم الرب يا ابائي وإخوتي. آمين.

Title.language: The Martyrdom of Saint (Mari) Behnam and Sarah, His Sister
The Martyrdom of Saint (Mari) Behnam and Sarah, His Sister
إستشهاد القديس بهنام و سارة أخته

text.language: On this day of the year 68 of the martyrs (352 A.D.), Saint Behnam and Sarah, his sister, the children of Sennacherib, King of Persia, were martyred. One day the prince Behnam went out with forty of his men hunting in the desert. He saw a huge wild game, so he pursued it for a long distance, and he was separated from his men. Night fell upon him and he had to sleep in that place in the wilderness. During his sleep he saw someone telling him; “go to St. Matthew who dwelt in this mountain and he would pray for your sister so that the Lord would heal her from her incurable illness.”

On this day of the year 68 of the martyrs (352 A.D.), Saint Behnam and Sarah, his sister, the children of Sennacherib, King of Persia, were martyred. One day the prince Behnam went out with forty of his men hunting in the desert. He saw a huge wild game, so he pursued it for a long distance, and he was separated from his men. Night fell upon him and he had to sleep in that place in the wilderness. During his sleep he saw someone telling him; “go to St. Matthew who dwelt in this mountain and he would pray for your sister so that the Lord would heal her from her incurable illness.”

فى مثل هذا اليوم من سنه 68 للشهداء (352 م) استشهد القديس بهنام و ساره أخته. إبنا سنحاريب ملك الفرس و ذلك أنه ذات يوم خرج الأمير بهنام مع أربعين من غلمانه للصيد فى الصحراء فرأى صيدا ً كبيرا ً فطارده مسافة طويلة حتى إبتعد عن غلمانه. فأمسى عليه الليل فإضطر أن يقضى ليلته فى مكانه في الصحراء فنام. و رأى فى نومه من يقول له : "إذهب إلى القديس متى الساكن فى هذا الجبل وهو يصلى من أجل أختك فيشفيها الرب من مرضها المستعصى".

When Mari Behnam woke up and was joined by his men, they searched for St. Matthew until they found him in a cave. Behnam greeted him, told him about the vision and asked him to accompany him to the city. St. Matthew rose up and went with him. On the way Behnam went before him to the city and told his mother about the vision and the presence of St. Matthew outside the city. Because of her love and trust in Behnam she allowed his sister to go with him in secret. St. Matthew prayed for Sarah and the Lord healed her. He exhorted and taught them the way of eternal life, the faith of the Lord Christ and they believed. He prayed also and a spring of water rushed forth and he baptized them in the name of the Father, and the Son and the Holy Spirit, the one God, then he returned to his cave.

He prayed also and a spring of water rushed forth and he baptized them in the name of the Father, and the Son and the Holy Spirit, the one God, then he returned to his cave.

فلما إستيقظ بهنام من نومه إجتمع بغلمانه و بحثوا عن القديس متى حتى وجدوه فى مغارة، فسلم عليه بهنام و أعلمه بالرؤيا وطلب منه الذهاب معه إلى المدينة فقام وذهب معه. وفى الطريق سبقه بهنام وأعلم والدته بالرؤيا و بوجود القديس متى خارج المدينة. ونظراً لمحبتها له سمحت بذهاب أخته معه سراً. فصلى عليها القديس متى فشفاها الرب ، ثم وعظها وعلمهما طريق الحياة الأبدية والإيمان بالسيد المسيح فآمن كلاهما ، و للوقت حينما آمنا صلى القديس متى أيضا ًفأنبع الرب عين ماء فعمدها باسم الآب والابن والروح القدس الإله الواحد ، ثم عاد إلى مكانه.

When King Sennacherib knew that his daughter was cured, he called her and asked her how she was cured. She told him, "The Lord Jesus Christ granted me the healing at the hands of St. Matthew and not through the stars that you worship." The king became angry at his children and threatened to punish and slay them if they did not turn away of their faith. During the night, St. Behnam and his sister decided to go together to St. Matthew to bid him farewell before their death. They went to the saint disguised, but the king sent his men after them and when they found the two saints they slew them thus they received the crown of martyrdom.

وعندما علم الملك سنحاريب بشفاء إبنته إستدعاها وسألها عن كيفية شفائها فقالت له: الرب يسوع المسيح هو الذى شفانى على يد القديس متى وليست الكواكب التى تعبدها أنت. فغضب الملك على ابنته و إبنه أيضاً و هددهما بالعقاب و الموت فلم يرجعا عن إيمانهما. وفى الليل تشاور بهنام مع أخته سارة أن يذهبا معا ً إلى القديس متى ليودعاه قبل أن يموتا. فسارا إليه خفية ، فأرسل الملك وراءهما من لحقهما فى الطريق و قتلهما ، فنال كلاهما إكليل الشهادة.

When the men who slew Mari Behnam and his sister Sarah went back, they found the king possessed by an evil spirit, which tormented him painfully. The queen sent for St. Matthew, begging him to come. When he arrived, he prayed for the king and the Lord healed him immediately. The saint explained to them the Christian faith, and the king, his wife, and all the people of the city, believed and were baptized by St. Matthew. Later on, the king built a large monastery for St. Matthew and placed the bodies of his children Mari Behnam, and his sister Sarah in it. The Lord manifested many healing signs and wonders through their bodies. A part of their relics is located in present time in the church that carries their names nearby the church of Mari Mina in Fum el-Khaleeg in Cairo.

وعاد قاتلو ماربهنام وسارة فوجدوا أن الملك قد أصابه روح نجس و كان يعذبه عذابا ً أليماً فأرسلت الملكة إلى القديس متى متوسلةً اليه أن يحضر ويشفيه ، وعند حضوره صلى على الملك فشفاه الرب فى الحال ، وأخذ القديس يشرح لهما الإيمان المسيحى ، فآمنا هما وكل أهل المدينة ثم عمدهم القديس متى جميعاً. بعد ذلك بنى الملك للقديس متى ديرا ً عظيما ً و وضع فيه جسدى إبنيه بهنام وسارة أخته ، وأظهر الرب من جسديهما آيات كثيرة للشفاء. ويوجد الآن جزء من جسديهما بالكنيسة التى تحمل اسميهما و الموجودة بجوار كنيسة القديس مارمينا بفم الخليج بالقاهرة.
The blessing of their prayers be with us all. Amen.

Title.language: The Martyrdom of Saint Ammonius, Bishop of Esna (Latopolis)
The Martyrdom of Saint Ammonius, Bishop of Esna (Latopolis)
إستشهاد القديس الأنبا أمونيوس أسقف إسنا

text.language: On this day also of the year 20 of the martyrs (304 A.D.) the great saint Abba Ammonius, Bishop of the city of (Latopolis) Esna, was martyred. Since his young age he was well mannered and was adorned with many virtues. Pope Peter, the Seal of Martyrs, ordained him a bishop over the city of Esna. Because of his strong desire for a solitary life, he built a monastery at the foot of the western mountain beside a spring of water. He prepared a cave where he stayed all week then went down to the city on Saturday to pray with the people the Sunday Liturgy. He exhorted and taught them. He also spent Monday with them to settle their disputes and take care of their needs. Then he returned to his cave to continue his worship and asceticism.

و فيه أيضا ً من سنه 20 للشهداء (304 م) إستشهد القديس العظيم الأنبا أمونيوس أسقف مدينة إسنا. و هو كان منذ حداثته حسن السيرة كثير الفضائل رسمه البابا بطرس خاتم الشهداء أسقفا ً على مدينة إسنا ولرغبته الشديدة فى الوحدة بنى ديرا ً على حافة الجبل الغربى بجوار عين ماء ، وأعد مغارة كان يقيم فيها طوال الأسبوع ، ثم يتركها يوم السبت إلى المدينة ليصلى مع الشعب قداس الأحد ، فيعظهم و يعلمهم و يقضى معهم أيضا ً يوم الاثنين يحل مشاكلهم ويدبر أمورهم ثم يعود إلى مغارته مداوما ً على النسك والعبادة.

Arianus the governor of Ansena went to Upper Egypt, to persecute the Christians, and order them to worship the idols. The angel of the Lord appeared to Anba Ammonius in his cave and told him; “The Lord had accepted your prayers on behalf of your people and had prepared the crowns for them. Arise, go down and confirm them in the faith of the Lord Christ."

وحدث أن ذهب أريانوس والى أنصنا إلى الصعيد ليضطهد المسيحيين و يأمرهم بعبادة الأوثان فظهر ملاك الرب للقديس أمونيوس فى مغارته وقال له : " الرب قبل صلواتك عن شعبك وهيأ لهم الأكاليل فقم إنزل و ثبتهم على الإيمان بالسيد المسيح ".

The saint arose and went down immediately and gathered the people. He informed them of what the angel had told him and encouraged them with his spiritual words. They all shouted out saying, "Our father, we are ready to withstand any suffering in the Name of the Lord Christ, even unto death." That took place on the feast of St. Isaac, whom the monastery in the mountain was after his name. He took his people up to the Aghathon Mount, which means the mount of goodness, to celebrate the feast there.

فنهض القديس ونزل وجمَّع الشعب وأخبرهم بالرؤيا و شجعهم بكلامه الروحى فصاح الجميع : " نحن يا أبانا على إستعداد أن نتحمل من أجل السيد المسيح كل عذاب حتى الموت". وكان فى ذلك اليوم عيد القديس إسحق الذى باسمه الدير الموجود فى الجبل ، فصعد القديس أمونيوس بشعبه كله إلى جبل أغاثون الذى تفسيره جبل الصلاح ، و إحتفل هناك بالعيد.

Arianus departed from Armunt and entered Esna and wandered in its streets which were empty. When he knew that the Bishop and his congregation went up the Aghathon Mount to pray he went to the place executing all the Christians he met on his way. He slew all the congregation praying on the mountain then seized Anba Ammonius and took him with him to Aswan then to Ansena. He delivered him to Harcus the captain of the soldiers who severely torture him. When he saw his steadfastness in the faith, the Governor ordered to burn him alive. The Saint asked for a respite to pray. After he finished praying they threw him into the fire where he delivered his pure soul.

When the fire was extinguished the believers took his pure body out which was untouched and unharmed by the fire. They shrouded the body and buried him in the city of Ansena.

During the reign of Emperor Constantine they built a church for Anba Ammonius in mount Esna, and went to Ansena to relocate the body to his church. They could not move it from his place and they heard a voice from the body saying, "This is the place that God chose for me." They recognized that it was the will of God so they left him and went back glorifying God in His saints.

Title.language: The Martyrdom of Saints Simeon of Menouf, Abba Hour (Hor), and Abba Mina the Elder
The Martyrdom of Saints Simeon of Menouf, Abba Hour (Hor), and Abba Mina the Elder
إستشهاد القديسين سمعان المنوفى و أباهور و أبا مينا الشيخ

text.language: Also on this day the church commemorates the martyrdom of St. Simeon of Menouf, the Saints Abba Hour (Hor) and Abba Mina the elder in the days of the Arabs. They publicly confessed their faith saying; “We are Christians believe in the Lord Christ, the Son of the living God, worship him and glorify Him with His good Father and the Holy Spirit.” They tormented them for many days with all means of tortures then beheaded them with the sword so they received the crowns of martyrdom.

Title.language: The Departure of Pope Christodoulos, 66th Pope of Alexandria
The Departure of Pope Christodoulos, 66th Pope of Alexandria
نياحة البابا خرستوذولوس البطريرك السادس والستين من بطاركة الكرازة المرقسية

text.language: Today also of the year 794 of the martyrs (1077 A.D.) marks the departure of Pope Christodoulos, 66th Pope of Alexandria. This saint was born and raised in a city called Bora then he went to el-Baramus monastery where he became a monk. He spent few years in the monastery during which he was ordained a priest. Then he left the monastery to live a solitary life in a cell on the sea shore and he was called the shut-in.

وفيه أيضا ً من سنة 794 للشهداء (1077 م) تنيح البابا خرستوذولوس البطريرك السادس والستين من بطاركة الكرازة المرقسية. ولد هذا القديس و تربى فى بلدة تسمى بورا ثم مضى وترهب بدير البرموس حيث قضى بضع سنوات نال خلالها رتبة الكهنوت وبعدها ترك الدير وانفرد فى صومعة على شاطئ البحر فى سنجار وسُمَّى بالحبيس.

He was chosen for the patriarchate and he took interest in building many new churches in Alexandria and renovated what was in ruins. He ordained for them a number of priests and deacons to serve them. He also wrote papal messages urging the people to hold fast to fasting, prayers, and to attend the divine Liturgies and partaking of the Holy Mysteries regularly. He also took interest in putting down Cannons necessary for the new circumstances that were facing the church which numbered twenty-one canons.

و حدث أن إختاروه للبطريركية فاهتم ببناء عدد من الكنائس الجديدة بالإسكندرية ، وإصلاح ما تخرب منها ، وبرسامة عدد من الكهنة والشمامسة اللازمين لها. كما كتب رسائل البابوية يحث فيها الشعب على التمسك بالصوم والصلاة والمواظبة على القداسات والتناول من الأسرار الإلهية. كما اهتم بوضع بعض القوانين اللازمة لمقابلة الظروف الجديدة التى تواجهها الكنيسة ، وكان عدد القوانين التى وضعها هى واحد وعشرون قانوناً.

On his first visit to Cairo, he saw the necessity of moving the papal residence from Alexandria to Cairo to be in close contact with the government and its rulers. He took the church of the Virgin, el-Mo’allaqah, in Old Cairo as his chosen official seat. He also renovated the church of the martyr Philopateer Mercurius, Abu-Saifain.

Pope Christodoulos toured most of the Egyptian cities visiting and overseeing the affairs of the churches. He also consecrated a Bishop for Nubia. He suffered many hardships from the rulers because of his steadfastness in the Christian faith and his active pastoral care. He endured it all patiently and with thanksgiving. When he completed his good endeavor departed in peace after spending thirty-one years on the throne of St. Mark. He was buried in the Church of the Virgin (suspended church) el-Mo’allaqah in Old Cairo with great veneration. His body was relocated later on to the monastery of St. Macarius in the wilderness of Shiheet.

Title.language: The Departure of Saint Christodoulos, the Anchorite
The Departure of Saint Christodoulos, the Anchorite
نياحة القديس خرستوذولوس السائح

text.language: On this day also was the departure of St. Christodoulos (servant of Christ) the anchorite. He was working as a jeweler in the city of Ayn-Shams. One day a beautiful woman brought him an old vessel made of gold and started to flirt with him saying; “Make rings for these fingers, bracelets for these arms, a cross for this chest and earrings for these ears." He replied saying, "Allow me today and as for tomorrow, may it be the will of God." At once he collected all his tools, closed his shop, and went home. He started rebuking himself saying, "O my soul you are not any stronger than the saints who escaped from this world and lived in the wilderness. O my soul escape from this world if you wish to be saved."

He recounted what happened to him to his mother and asked her to allow him to go to the wilderness. She asked him to take her first to one of the convents where she can dwell therein. He took her to one of the convents and entrusted her to the abbess. He gave her whatever money she needed, and he gave the rest to the poor.

Subsequently he went toward the desert. After walking three days, he saw three anchorites, each one with a cross shining brighter than the Sun in his hand. He dwelt there persevering in prayers, and fasting. He ate from the fruits of the trees in the valley.

After a short illness he departed in peace. They prayed over him and buried him.

Title.language: The Fifteenth Day of the Blessed Month of Koiahk
The Fifteenth Day of the Blessed Month of Koiahk
اليوم الخامس عشر من شهر كيهك المبارك

text.language: Today is the fifteenth day of the blessed month of Koiahk. May God begin it in goodness and renew it for us in peace and tranquility, while our sins and iniquities are forgiven through the tender mercies of our Lord, O my fathers and my brethren. Amen.

Title.language: The Departure of St. Gregory, Patriarch of the Armenians
The Departure of St. Gregory, Patriarch of the Armenians
نياحة القديس غريغوريوس بطريرك الأرمن

text.language: This day of the year 38 of the martyrs (322 A.D.) marks the departure of St. Gregory, the Patriarch of the Armenians who was a martyr, without bloodshed.

This saint was born about the year 257 A.D. in the capital of the province of Ararat in Armenia. His father’s name was Anak (Anash) of royal descendant and he was put to death, but Gregory and his brother survived. Their caregiver fled away with them to Caesarea, Cappadocia, where she raised them in a life of piety and holiness. Gregory was adorned with many Christian virtues and he excelled in Philosophy and various subjects. Then He served in the royal court of king Tiridates.

When king Tiridates killed Arbsima, the virgin, and all the virgins who were with her , he also ordered to cast their bodies away on the mountains. While he was riding his horse, an evil spirit possessed him. He fell on the ground and started to bite his body. Great fear and crying was heard all over the royal palace.

Title.language: The Departure of St. Lucas, the Stylite
The Departure of St. Lucas, the Stylite
نياحة القديس لوكاس العمودى

text.language: On this day also, St. Lucas (Luke), the Stylite, departed. This saint was born in one of the Persian countries to Christian parents. They reared him up on the Christian morals. When he became a young man, he enlisted in the Roman army, was promoted up the ranks until he became a centurion.

Title.language: The Departure of the saint Anba Ezekiel, a native of Armunt
The Departure of the saint Anba Ezekiel, a native of Armunt
نياحة القديس الأنبا حزقيال من أرمنت

text.language: Today also marks the departure of the saint Anba Ezekiel. This saint was a native of the city of Armunt. He left his family and went up the Armunt mount where he met with some of the fathers the anchorites. They guided him to the life of seclusion and put on him the monastic Eskeem. This saint lived in the inner wilderness in austere asceticism and toiled in many spiritual works.

Title.language: The Departure of the Righteous Gideon, One of the Judges of Israel
The Departure of the Righteous Gideon, One of the Judges of Israel
نياحة البار جدعون أحد قضاة بنى إسرائيل

text.language: On this day, of the year 1349 B.C., the righteous Gideon, one of the Judges of Israel, departed. He was from the tribe of Manasseh and his father's name was "Joash". While Gideon threshed wheat in the winepress the angel of the Lord appeared to him and said, "The Lord is with you, you mighty man of valor." (Judges 6:12) Gideon said to him, "O my lord, if the Lord is with us, why then has all these hardships happened to us? And where are all His miracles which our fathers told us about saying, 'Did not the Lord bring us up from Egypt?' But now the Lord has forsaken us and delivered us into the hands of Midianites."(Judges 6:13-14)

He kept decreasing the number until they counted only three hundred men. With this few number of men, Gideon overcame the Midianites. He captured much of the spoil, and became a judge for Israel for about forty years.

text.language: This day also of the year 20 of the martyrs (304) Sts. Eulogius and Arsenius, Patron saints of El-Hadid monastery in Akhmeem were martyred.

They were from Syria, came to Egypt and dwelt on the Akhmeem mount. When Arianus came to Akhmeem they confessed the Lord Christ before him. The governors ordered to hang them head down, then tied heavy stones to their legs and were thrown into the river. The Lord saved them from drowning and brought them safe to the shore.

Later on Arianus convened three court sessions to try to persuade them at times and threatened and promised them at other times to turn them away from their faith in the Lord Christ. Finally when he could not change their steadfast in the faith, he ordered to behead them with the sword, so they received the crown of martyrdom.

Title.language: The Martyrdom of St. Amsah el-Quifty
The Martyrdom of St. Amsah el-Quifty
إستشهاد القديس أمساح القفطى

text.language: On this day also was the Martyrdom of St. Amsah of Qift (el-Qifty). When Arianus the governor of Ansena arrived to the coast of Qift, the pagan priests went out to meet him and boast before him saying; “There is no one in our city to mention the name of Christ” so he rewarded them with many gifts.

وفيه أيضاً أستشهد القديس إمساح القفطى. فكان حين وصل أريانوس الوالى إلى ساحل قفط خرج كهنة الاصنام لمقابلته وإفتخروا أمامه قائلين " ليس فى مدينتنا من يذكر إسم المسيح " فأعطاهم هدايا كثيرة.

In the city there was a young Christian whose name was Amsah. He dwelt with his virgin sister, Theodora living and working in a small garden, donating what exceeded their needs. When Amsah heard what the pagan priests said, he rose and went to the city of Tkoou where he found the governor torturing the Christians. He cried out saying; “I am Christian.” The governor became angry and ordered to beat him with green Palm-leaf stalk. His blood flew on the ground and he fainted so they cast him in prison. In the next morning they found him standing up praying.

The governor ordered to wrap him in a straw mat and cast him in the Nile River thus he delivered up his spirit and received the crown of martyrdom.

She went and found as the angel told her. She recovered the body, shrouded and buried him with great honor.

text.language: On this day the church celebrates the commemoration of the relocation of the body of the great ascetic St. Lukas the Stylite .

When he departed on top of the pillar that he dwelt on nearby Constantinople, his disciples went and told the Patriarch about his departure. He took with him the priests, crosses and censers and went to where the body of the saint was. They carried him to Constantinople with hymns, praises and prayers. After they prayed over him, the believers received the blessing from his pure body. They placed him in a marble sarcophagus next to the bodies of the saints. God manifested many signs and miracles from his body.

text.language: On this day also of the year 20 of the martyrs (304 A.D.) was the martyrdom of Anba Elias, bishop of el-Moharraq monastery and El-Kosiah.
On this day also of the year 20 of the martyrs (304 A.D.) was the martyrdom of Anba Elias, bishop of el-Moharraq monastery and El-Kosiah.
وفيه أيضا ً من سنه 20 للشهداء (304 م) إستشهد القديس الأنبا إيلياس أسقف دير المحرق و القوصية.

This Holy Father strove much in prayers and lived a godly life. One day a poor man came to him crying because he suffered injustice from the clerk of El-Kosiah. The saint went and admonished the clerk saying; “God speedily avenge for the poor, for He is the Father of the orphans and the Advocate of the widows. O my son pays attention to the salvation of your soul.” The clerk wept, regretted and knelt before the saint. He returned all what he took from this poor man and he became meek, merciful and loving to the poor and the needy.

كان هذا القديس يجاهد كثيرا ً فى الصلوات ويسير سيرة حسنة وذات يوم حضر إليه رجل فقير يبكى لأن كاتب القوصية ظلمه فذهب إليه القديس ووبخه قائلا ً "الله ينتقم سريعا ً للمساكين ، فهو أب الأيتام وقاضى الأرامل ، فاهتم ياابنى بخلاص نفسك". فبكى الكاتب وندم وخر عند قدمى القديس ، وأعاد لذلك المسكين كل ما أخذه منه ، وصار بعد ذلك متضعا ً رحوما ً محبا ً للفقراء و المساكين.

When Arianus the governor heard of St. Elias and what he performed from miracles and signs he summoned him. He promised him with many honors if he raised incense to the idols. The saint replied saying;”I do not worship devils and you Arianus will be martyred in the name of Christ.” The governor became angry and tortured him with many tortures then ordered to behead him so he received the crown of martyrdom.

سمع أريانوس الوالى بالقديس أيلياس وما يصنعه من الآيات والعجائب ، فاستدعاه ووعده بكرامات كثيرة إذا بخر للأوثان ، فقال له القديس " أنا لا أسجد للشياطين ، وأنت يا أريانوس سوف تستشهد على اسم المسيح ". فغضب الوالى وعذبه عذابات كثيرة ، ثم أمر بقطع رأسه فنال إكليل الشهادة.
The blessing of his prayers be with us all and glory be to our God for ever. Amen.
